data.title: Fix IK not being solved while dragging a bone (2.1)
data.body: Fixes #8422

data.title: TSCN files that embeds 2 images are not all loaded + side effects
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 5, Godot 2.1.3, probably affects master

**Issue description:**
Probably related to #4240 
Loading a TSCN file that embeds 2 images has the following effects:
- only the 1st image is loaded.
- the second is not (appears as null in Godot editor)
- certain following values are loaded either

**Steps to reproduce:**
1/ Clone the following branch : https://github.com/StraToN/escoria/tree/c-cesar-master
2/ Import project in Godot (device/ folder)
3/ Load scenes/test/test.tscn
4/ Confirm that:
- scales contains an image
- lightmap is null (should be an image)
- bitmaps_scale is 1,1 (should be 2.35, 1.5)

**Link to minimal example project:**
https://github.com/StraToN/escoria/tree/c-cesar-master


Fixing this would allow us to pull https://github.com/godotengine/escoria/pull/4 in Escoria
Another solution would be of course to use external resources, not embed in TSCN.

data.title: Feature request: Get position in viewport
data.body:
So local vs global coordinate systems were a bane of my existence for a pretty long time. Moving children of different parents to each other (for sick UI effects for example) can get insane with get_position_in_parent()+get_parent().get_position_in_parent() and so on for each parent you have. 

What I'm sure a lot of people will find use of is a quick and simple way to just grab coordinates of a node with viewport 0.0 being origin and move them based on that.

data.title: Add a portable way to prevent files/folders from being imported
data.body:
For a game project or plugin for the assetlib, it would be useful to tell Godot to ignore some files or directories from being imported, a bit like a `.gitignore` that applies to its own folder and child folders. Such a file would also make the feature portable because it doesn't need a project setting that would require projects to be intrusively modified.

Context: in 3.0, I am developing a GDNative plugin with an src/ folder for the C++ project. During development, compilation generates lots of files with various extensions, .obj among them, and Godot thinks they are meshes and chokes at importing them. Because the import is automatic it happens as soon as I focus Godot, which is really annoying. This is one reason why I think a `.godotignore` feature would be useful.

data.title: Clarification of degrees/radians in angle methods
data.body: Added and/or clarified angle-based methods to indicate use of radians or degrees.

data.title: Metallic workflow textures aren't stored efficiently
data.body: In the current implementation, metallic workflow uses R and A components of the image, for which only 16BPP space is required. However, they are stored as 32BPP RGBA images after they are imported.

data.title: Clarification of degrees/radians in angle methods
data.body: Added and/or clarified angle-based methods to indicate use of radians or degrees.

data.title: ETC2 compression support
data.body:
I'm opening a new issue since there doesn't appear to be an open issue for this.

We can adapt the Apache-licensed [etc2comp](https://github.com/google/etc2comp) for this feature (a blog post about it [here](https://medium.com/@duhroach/building-a-blazing-fast-etc2-compressor-307f3e9aad99)).

data.title: Feature request - get local rotation
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64 bit Godot 2.1.3

I would like a local equivalent to get_rotation()

Use case: need to know the angle of a child object compared to the parent (e.g. a wheel on a car, a gun on a tank, a thruster on a spaceship etc. etc.)

data.title: [GDNative] explicit calling convention
data.body:
There was no explicitly defined calling convention for function pointers used in GDNative.

This makes it easier (and more predicatble) for other compilers to generate working code.

data.title: [Question] Is it possible to remap mouse buttons in the 3D viewport?
data.body:
I specifically want to swap Mouse2 and Mouse3.

I know this scheme is inspired by Blender, but it can be no secret that Blender has very odd defaults, which is also why it's a must that it can be changed in the user preferences.

data.title: Feature request: separate fullscreen state for scene view and script editor
data.body:
Most of the time using script editor is best in fullscreen mode (activated with shortcut).
Most of the time you would want to use scene editor in normal mode.
Currently you have to manually switch modes every time you switch between script and scene editors. It would be nice to have editors to remember their screen mode separately, so you won't have to do extra actions when switching between editors.

data.title: Artifacts in unused window areas
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Arch Linux - Godot master build


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I'm trying to create a game such that the viewport is always rendered in 320x240 and the result is upscaled while maintaining aspect ratio. The desired effect is achieved but it seems that the unused space isn't cleared properly and artifacts remain as can be seen in the screenshot. I am running i3 and compton if this matters at all.

![2017-04-18-214641_690x310_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13008557/25163706/0f427726-2481-11e7-8b72-de52ed6352e5.png)


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Set stretch mode to viewport and aspect ratio to keep.
2. Run project and attempt to resize window.

data.title: Set attenuation by inputing numbers
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win 7 64 bit Godot 2.1.3

I would like an ability to set attenuation for lights by inputing numbers (in addition to the existing way of dragging the curve around).

Use case: I have two headlights on my car, and for obvious reasons I want their parameters to be identical when tweaking them. Using presets, when I'm constantly changing values, is an overkill.

data.title: Move official demos to the Assetlib
data.body:
**Issue description:**
I've been noticing that a lot of newcomers seek solutions/examples of things which are nicely available in the official demos. However, most people don't even know they exist due to the fact that - except in Steam -  they need to be downloaded separately. 

In line with what, for instance, UE4 provides, I think it would make sense to move the demos to the Asset Lib as part of our "Online Content". 

There are many advantages to this

- newcomers that see the assetlib on start can easily see the official demos
- no need for extra download and knowing where to unzip the demos to
- no need to install dozens of demos when you just want a specific one

data.title: Fixed that playing the project opens the project manager
data.body: Fixes #8445

data.title: Object bounding boxes are always zero
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** v3 master, Linux


**Issue description:**
I've been wondering why performance seems to be affected when I hide objects which are already outside the screen and eventually found out that the bounding boxes are not being calculated and/or used correctly.
get_aabb() always returns a rect with all zeros too.

data.title: Playing the project opens project manager instead of game window
data.body:
Arch Linux, Latest Godot3 master build (7088d9e)

Just compiled a fresh build from Godot3 master branch and I'm having some new weird issues, that may or may not be related to each other:

1. My project list is now empty and i can't seem to scan for or import any old projects (done with earlier godot3 builds)
2. Whenever I run my newly created project, the Project Manager keeps popping up instead of the game window

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. try to scan for or import any older (godot3) project
2. create a new project
3.  run it

Edit:
The Project Manger only pops up when playing the project(F5). Playing the edited scene(F6) works as expected.

data.title: Script editor now automatically completes file paths in GDScript
data.body:
I'm not sure this functionality is really desired by any other developers but for me, it was very helpful.
The completion turns on if you type in `load`/`preload` ~~or ` "res:` (in any function parameter),~~ and lists every file visible in the filesystem dock.
This might be annoying for some people, so I added an editor option for turning it off.
The only related issue I could find: #2982

data.title: Backport some 2.2 features into 2.1 branch?
data.body:
As time went on, I ended up sticking with 2.2 for my current project because of it's rather handy features like the ternary operator or the no distraction mode. I kinda found it strange how most of the newer features weren't introduced in the 2.1 branch.

Would it be a hassle to backport some 2.2 features to the 2.1 branch? For example, for low-DPI screens the fullscreen/no distraction mode comes quite in handy, especially when it comes to script editing, so it'd be still a nice addition for the 2.1.4 release.

data.title: Fix error for loading icon image at start up
data.body:
This will fix error below at starting up game if project has converting images to webp at Project export settings > Images.
```
ERROR: load_image: Error opening file: res://icon.png
   At: core/io/image_loader.cpp:53.
```

note that this does not fix changing application icon.

data.title: Fix PRNG randomization.
data.body:
PCG32 doesn't like small seeds, which leads to zero random values (prior to #7532, zero values were handled as special cases).

Use a large default seed, and also add a shift in Math::randomize.

Fixes #8423.

data.title: [GDNative] added "new" method and fixed headers
data.body: Fixes #8432

data.title: Correct gdnative signatures
data.body:
This PR does two things:
- Correct Vector2&Vector3 function signature to copy Godot Variant's policy concerning passing by value vs by pointer (i.e. small object like Vector3 are always passed by value where bigger like Basis are passed by pointer), as dicussed with @karroffel 
- Implement `godot_basis` missing functions

data.title: AudioPlayer.get_pos() always is 0
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux Mint Mate 18.1 (x86_64), last Godot Engine 3.0 build 
**Issue description:** `AudioPlayer.get_pos()` always returns 0, even if the music is playing right now.
**Steps to reproduce:** Add root Node2D, add AudioPlayer with some ogg music, add script:
```
func _ready():
	$AudioPlayer.play()
	set_process(true)

func _process(delta):
	print(str($AudioPlayer.get_pos()))
```
Music plays. Information about the current position of the music being played is not updated.
